result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Manuel Madrigal

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan Manuel Madrigal appeared by video.  Attorney Rebecca M Coffee appeared by video for Juan Manuel Madrigal.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel has discovery and offer and requests additional time to meet with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br.41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Manuel Madrigal in court.  Attorney Rebecca M Coffee in court for Juan Manuel Madrigal.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Remaining cash bail previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Violent Contact Order.  Defendant to have no violent contact with DJS.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Juan Manuel Madrigal in court.  Attorney Rebecca M Coffee in court for Juan Manuel Madrigal.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim present with Victim Witness and made statement. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
